description.value: Used on a creature the strangler has applied the grab condition to, this causes them to become unable to speak or use verbal components. If this is held for two rounds consecutively, the victim becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as blood ceases to flow properly. If this is held for three rounds, the victim loses consciousness. Creatures that do not breathe are not silenced by this. Creatures without blood cannot be slowed or knocked out by this ability.
The strangler can lapse into fits of rage, giving it a +1 bonus to attack rolls and +3 bonus to damage rolls. This lasts for 3 rounds. It cannot be used again for one minute.

To clear space around itself, a strangler can brush enemies back. Make an @Check[athletics] check and compare it to the Fortitude DC of each enemy within 5 feet. A success pushes them back 5 feet. A critical success increases this to 15 feet. If the creature cannot be pushed back due to something blocking their movement, they take damage as if hit with the strangler's tail slap and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
